Snow White is in my opinion a bad movie on an artistic point of view. The plot is pretty much foreseeable, the characters are stereotypes, the editing too. The movie has got little more to do with Disney fairy tales than your usual Tarantino's work.
Fortunately it saves itself by sticking to a pretty traditional questing couple. I like films that give pratical excuses for themselves as much as anyone else but unlike found-footage Snow White's excuse is being severely stretched:

Michael Dudikoff stars as Joe Armstrong a martial artist who fights ninjas who are stealing weapons from the U.S Army, in this entertaining yet admittedly brainless action film. In Canada stopping for fuel, Joe comes across a group of martial arts experts ; Bruce Conrad (Chuck 2), Mason Mary and Steve Waldman (No Retreat No Surrender).
